conclusion: A moves toward the cluster with a moderate speed and a roughly straight trajectory.
The red cube is the closest to A’s entry path.
A’s right front corner touches the red cube, resulting in a glancing collision.
The impact is off-center, transferring only part of A’s forward kinetic energy and converting some to a sideways deflecting impulse.
The red cube acquires a small forward-left velocity, and A is deflected slightly right-to-left, losing speed in the forward direction.
After deflection, A’s new path points toward the central green cube.
The green cube is struck more centrally, receiving most of A’s remaining forward momentum.
This collision slows A to well under half its original speed.
A is now almost coasting and is wedged among several cubes, with rolling friction and micro-taps dissipating the rest of its energy.
A finally stops near the green cube that sits just left of the original orange cube pair, roughly one cube-width inside the cluster, slightly left of center.
A comes to rest just inside the cluster, next to the central green cube, slightly left of the overall center of the scattered cubes.
